content.description: The long traverse spans the boulder starting in a shallow dihedral on the far right side. The start isnt too well defined and you'll find yourself scratching your head looking for the best way to start this. Either way, start with low holds in the dihedral and work your way leftward. Using the prominent gaston and long seam, continue working leftwards and mantle on to the upper section of the boulder.
content.protection: 2-3 pads. Due to the traversy nature of this climb, you'll probably need a string of pads.

content.description: Time to hone in your dyno skills! This one has seen a bit of crumbling on the start hold so a community censuses on the grade is probably needed. Start with both hands on crimps in the seam. From here, dyno to the sloping lip. You'll trend right around lip and mantle up on to the face.
content.protection: 2-3 pads. The landing is rather flat but you'll want a few for the dyno

content.description: This is another area relatively close to the Teddy Bear boulder. While this section only hosts 2 established lines, they're definitely worth checking out.
